alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 4:58PM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. Passaic River Above Singac affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Essex and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Millington, Chatham, Pine Brook, Singac, Little Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield begins to flood. Finns Drive, Siesta Drive, and Market street in Wayne are all susceptible to flooding. William Street, Louis Street, and Zeliff Avenue in Little Falls can begin to flood. Portions of Lincoln Park become impassable. The Meadows Golf Club in Lincoln Park floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to a crest of 9.7 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 05/03/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 8.2 Thu 4 pm 9.6 9.5 9.7 1am 12/30 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EST.
